description.narrative:
The "Access to Livelihoods, Inclusive Value Chains and Empowerment" (ALIVE) team is contributing to the implementation of the Strategic Partnership (SP) programme. ln its planning it has been agreed to contribute to the outcomes of the "Right to Food" component. One of ALIVE's activities is to strengthen CSOs to enable them to increase their access to and influence on the private sector. Thiswas based on various expressed needs from the participating countries in the SP. There is a great need within Oxfam offices and Oxfam partners to increase capacity on private sector influencing approaches, tools and skills.
ln close consultation with other ONL departments it was agreed that in year 1 of SP implementation ALIVE would work on a Private Sector resource package, which would try to be an accessible and practical introduction to Oxfam PS policies, approaches, experiences so far and tools. There is a good drafttext for the "PS influencing resource pack", but it needs to be developed further. This project will support this in two ways: 1. Support improvement of accessibility of the resource pack: through improved editing but also on how to publish it on the Oxfam International Private Sector pages oon the OI website 2. Support Oxfam in preparation and implementation of the planned training/workshop in Asia on PS influencing beginning of 2018 and assure that these are connected to the needs and contexts of the participating countries and partners.
The project will be implemented by CSR Asia. CSR Asia is very experienced in providing trainings on private sector influencing and is already a long time partner of Oxfam.

participating-org.narrative:
CSR Asia was created in 2004 in Hong Kong by a group of founders who believed business could be a positive force for change. The organization was a sustainability pioneer in Asia, and has grown alongside sustainability awareness in the region. It was designed to help organizations create positive impact for themselves and the wider world through responsible, inclusive and sustainable business.
Starting off with just one office in Hong Kong, CSR Asia has grown to become a trusted expert on sustainability issues across Asia with 5 offices including Singapore, Bangkok, Sydney and Tokyo.
CSR Asia promotes sustainability through a wide range of channels including advisory services, networks, platforms for cross sector collaboration and by providing access to a repository of insights.In 2017, a new phase for CSR Asia began when it was acquired by ELEVATE, an industry leader in sustainability and supply chain services globally. ELEVATE has integrated like-minded, mission-driven companies such as CSR Asia to create a global sustainability platform to support sustainable, balanced and inclusive economic growth for employees, employers and the planet

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood

description.narrative: Strengthened CSOs: # CSOs increasingly participate in or initiate influencing towards adopting/monitoring implemention of smallholder inclusive agribusiness investment policies, in line with social, economic and environmental responsibility standards
